data.title: Fix for missing titlebar menu on OS X.
data.body:
On OS X, if you command click the title of a window that's associated with a document, you get a menu where each item is a parent of its path. (You can try this in Pages, Finder, Sublime, even Safari). This is currently missing in Atom. The fix is pretty straightforward, just call setRepresentedFilename (which is implemented to do nothing on other platforms in atom-shell).

![title-bar-menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/23753/3914633/7abea85c-234a-11e4-8baa-97228ab50c5a.gif)

Reviewed by @tolmasky.

data.title: Move checkout head to Git class
data.body:
Checkout head logic was incorrectly added to the Editor class instead of the Git class when the feature was originally added years ago.

This moves that logic into the Git class where it belongs.

data.title: Switch between header and implementation file `Alt + O`
data.body: One very handy feature when programming with C, C++ or Objective-C is switching between header (.h, .hpp, .hh) and the matching implementation file (.c, .cpp, .cc, .m, .mm). Sublime Text (and some other editors) allow this with the key combination `Alt + O` (on Windows and Linux).

data.title: Comments and the insertion point
data.body:
When on a blank line in an HTML file, typing command-/ inserts a comment <!-- --> but puts the insertion point after the closing comment tag, instead of inside the tags where the comment should go. I always need to click to move the insertion point.

If nothing is selected, then insert a comment and allow me to type something into it. If something is selected, then wrap that in a comment and then allow me to add to the comment.

Like parens: If nothing is selected and I type an open paren, I get a paren pair and type inside it. If something is selected and I type an open paren, I get the selection wrapped in a paren pair and I can cursor-left or cursor-right to disable the selection, then type.

data.title: core:undo character wise
data.body:
I've noticed that if I use the `core:undo` command, it often undoes every single character from something I've written, not "wordwise", like Sublime Text does. Is there a way so change this behavior?

Thanks.

data.body: Currently the only way to change the language of a file is to go to the bottom status bar.
